title: Data Quality Analyst
description:
ABOUT US 
 Pareto Advisers is a boutique firm specializing in IT process optimization and security for US healthcare companies. You'll find us at the crossroads of data-driven solutions and solid relationships where our fresh approach and distinctly personal touch produce results. Headquartered in Baltimore, Pareto Advisers serves communities in Maryland, DC and West Virginia, improving care for more than 6 million consumers each year. 
 The role is dedicated full time to CRISP, a regional health information exchange (HIE) serving Maryland, the District of Columbia and West Virginia. CRISP is a non-profit organization that improves patient care by sharing healthcare information between more than 40,000 healthcare providers. 
 ABOUT YOU 
 You're dynamic, data-driven and dream of a meaningful positive impact on healthcare, using data. You understand the work that goes into continual improvement and can make it happen through measurable results. You wear your nerd badge with pride and want to use your skills for good, so making healthcare healthier piques your interest. You embody an entrepreneurial spirit, thrive in a start-up environment, and you aren't afraid to ask questions when you don't know something. Other people like you, because you're smart, endlessly curious and deliver results. 
 ABOUT THE JOB 
 The Data Quality Analyst addresses the full range of data needs for CRISP and with the Department of Health Care Finance (DHCF), starting with data processing and integration and then culminating in insightful report design and development. S/he leverages key technologies including SAS, SQL, PowerBI, and Tableau to extract insight from data. At CRISP this role works in all aspects of data integration, processing, and validation to ensure the information provided to users is accurate and complete. S/he supports CRISP Washington DC team and DHCF to design and develop reports that quickly synthesize large amounts of information into one platform, providing clients with easy to access data insights. Additionally, the Data Quality Analyst would have a thorough understanding of the source and structure of underlying data used to produce reports and can help key stakeholders on root cause analysis on unexpected results. 
 RESPONSIBILITIES 
 Support data integration by defining requirements, streamlining processes, promoting transparency, and developing complex logicIdentify key data needs and reporting requirementsEnhance and automate data and reporting processesDesign and develop reports in Excel, SQL, SAS, and TableauPerform data analysis in SAS and SQL to identify factors to be considered in future reports, provide historical trend analytics, and supply requested metricsProvide administrative support of CRISP DC/IAPD initiatives such as coordination, development, quality assurance, documentation, background research and deployment of reports 
 QUALIFICATIONS 
 Ability to find patterns in data that result in measurable positive business improvements.Outstanding organizational and interpersonal skills with all levels in the organizationAbility to initiate and follow through on multiple tasks across several projects and has effective time management skills.Ability in quantitative and qualitative analysisFamiliarity with web-based tools and other reporting tools, data mining skills a plusPossession and demonstration of high energy, flexibility, creativity and good judgmentAbility to communicate effectively, both verbal and writtenFamiliarity with healthcare industry and key stakeholders preferred 
 Education and/or Experience  
 Bachelor’s degree in public policy, public health and/or health information technology1-3 years experience with data-oriented projects. May substitute relevant coursework for experience.Working knowledge of Excel, SAS, SQL, and TableauExperience working with clinical data or informaticsKnowledge of PowerBI preferred

 We're a small company with big clients and even bigger plans for the future. No office politics. No micromanagement.

title: Billing & Collections Data Analyst
description:
The Collections Data Analyst provides support and recommendations to the WSSC Billing and Revenue Protection division, based upon insight generated through world class data analytics and predictive techniques. The incumbent provides the primary business analysis and project management support for revenue assurance and collections activities to deliver efficient and effective service to internal and external customers.
In this role, they facilitate the end to end collections strategy design to ensure effective and optimal use of resources and minimization of delinquencies while reducing revenue leakage and enabling customers to maintain service. Incumbent operates with limited supervision and is responsible for training colleagues.
Essential Functions Performs in-depth analysis on delinquent accounts, reviews existing collections strategies and provides Senior Management with proposals to help drive positive customer outcomes and revenue protection. Collaborates with Customer Service and Utility Services to drive real and constant business change. Completes analytics work with minimal oversight and brings suggestions forward to drive direction. Analyzes data using tools such as SQL, VBA, and MS Excel. Manages projects to enhance business performance and drive process improvements. Reviews the entire collections and credit risk lifecycle to help ensure a continuous and seamless customer journey. Uses analytical approaches such as Variable Analysis & Segmentation, Net Present Value and Forecasting, test and learn techniques, alongside strong data extraction skills to suggest ways to optimize billing and collections strategies. Proposes and designs new strategies that improve customer engagement and operational effectiveness. Performs Root Cause Analysis to understand limitations of the current collections strategy and propose improvements. Evaluates and maintains customer payment arrangement plans and collectors tools to use in delinquency resolution. Influences design of and ensures optimization of any collections programs. Ensures strategies are compliant with all regulatory rules and requirements. Works with IT and other departments to ensure proposals are implementable, implemented robustly and monitored/controlled effectively.
Other Functions Develops ad hoc training to enable succession planning options and broaden overall capability. Build relationships with key stakeholders across business, finance, risk, operations to enable support for collections strategies. Performs other related duties as assigned.
Work Environment And Physical Demands N/A
Required Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Ability to drive work forward independently and collaborate as a member of a team to push thinking and take projects to business leading solutions. Given a ‘theme’ has the ability to independently analyze, draw conclusions and make recommendations. Good communication skills. Strong work ethic & team skills. Ability to manage a project to agreed schedule, budget, scope, and quality. Ability to put our customers’ needs first. Ability to contribute to an inspired workplace that is focused on success and treating our customers fairly. Ability to demonstrate integrity and respect within the workplace through dealings with colleagues and customers. Ability to be innovative and creative in approach – seeking new opportunities to improve our customer experience, our brand, the business and ourselves. Process mapping and business analysis skills.
Minimum Education, Experience Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Technology, Finance, Statistics or a related field. Project management experience. OR High school diploma or equivalent. 6 years data analysis experience. Project management experience.

description:

 For more information about CRISP, please visit: https://www.crisphealth.org/ 
 Job Summary:  
 The CRISP DC Data Quality Analyst addresses the full range of data needs for CRISP and with the DHCF (Department of Health Care Finance), starting with data processing and integration and then culminating in insightful report design and development. S/he leverages key technologies including SAS, SQL, PowerBI, and Tableau to extract insight from data. At CRISP this role works in all aspects of data integration, processing, and validation to ensure the information provided to users is accurate and complete. S/he supports CRISP DC team and DHCF to design and develop reports that quickly synthesize large amounts of information into one platform, providing clients with easy to access data insights. Additionally, the Data Quality Analyst would have a thorough understanding of the source and structure of underlying data used to produce reports and can help key stakeholders on root cause analysis on unexpected results. 
 ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:  
 The CRISP DC Data Quality Analyst role will entail the following items, as well as other duties as assigned. 
 Support data integration by defining requirements, streamlining processes, promoting transparency, and developing complex logicIdentify key data needs and reporting requirementsEnhance and automate data and reporting processesDesign and develop reports in Excel, SQL, SAS, and TableauPerform data analysis in SAS and SQL to identify factors to be considered in future reports, provide historical trend analytics, and supply requested metricsProvide administrative support of CRISP DC/IAPD initiatives such as coordination, development, quality assurance, documentation, background research and deployment of reports 
 Qualifications 
 To perform this job successfully, the incumbent must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 
 Outstanding organizational and interpersonal skills with all levels in the organizationAbility to initiate and follow through on multiple tasks across several projects and has effective time management skills.Ability in quantitative and qualitative analysisFamiliarity with web-based tools and other reporting tools, data mining skills a plusPossession and demonstration of high energy, flexibility, creativity and good judgmentAbility to communicate effectively, both verbal and writtenFamiliarity with healthcare industry and key stakeholders preferred 
 Education and/or Experience 
 Bachelor’s degree in public policy, public health and/or health information technology1-3 years experience with data-oriented projects. May substitute relevant coursework for experience.Working knowledge of Excel, SAS, SQL, and TableauExperience working with clinical data or informaticsKnowledge of PowerBI preferred

 Salary: $75,000.00 to $90,000.00 /year

title: Aviation Data Analyst
description:
Position Overview  
 This is an exciting and challenging position with the opportunity to support aviation research, data analysis, and National Airspace System (NAS) performance measures and be at the leading edge of new Air Traffic Management (ATM) concepts. 
 This is a full-time mid-level staff position to be located on-site in an FAA facility in Washington D.C. The successful candidate will participate in the analysis of aviation data to support research on trajectory-based air traffic performance measures of current and new capabilities. A background check will be required for this position. 
 Essential Job Functions:  
 Development and implementation of NAS data processing tools and analysis of trajectory measuresDevelopment and analysis of integration of various data sources into databases in support of performance analysisDevelopment of tools that support data verification for FAA trajectory databasesDocumentation and testing of softwarePreparing papers and presentations that summarize the data analysis research activitiesWorking closely with government aviation users/customers 
 Qualifications 
 B.S. degree in the area of computer science or other technical field including engineering or other physical sciencesSix to ten years of relevant experience (three to seven years with a Master’s degree in a related field)Experience creating browser-based visualization tools and dashboards using Javascript, Tableau, R Shiny, and/or similar technologiesSoftware programming experience in Java, C, C++, html, and object-oriented methodologiesExperience with R or other statistical/mathematical analysis softwareExcellent PC applications skills with office tools including Excel, PowerPoint and WordExcellent written and oral communication skills and interpersonal relations skills 
 Additional Desired Skills:  
 Software lifecycle development experience that involved requirements analysis, verification and validation, configuration management, and documentation/trainingExperience with ArcGIS visualization tools and ability to produce toolboxes for aviation data analysisExperience with aircraft, air traffic control, traffic flow management, automation, navigation, and/or surveillance systemsAir traffic data analytical expertise (especially with air traffic trajectory data and large data sets)A strong interest in the aviation field and solid understanding of the National Airspace System (NAS) and future NextGen conceptsAbility to conduct modeling and/or database-based engineering analysis 
 Position Type:  Full Time 
 Keywords:  NAS data, performance analysis, Air Traffic Management (ATM) knowledge, Trajectory Based Operations (TBO), Analyst, Engineer, Java, C, C++, object-oriented

company: Government of the District of Columbia
title: Data Analyst
description:
This position is located in the Department of Health (DOH), HIV/AIDS, Hepatitis, STD and TB Administration (HAHSTA). HAHSTA is charged with the responsibilities of preventing and decreasing the incidence and prevalence of sexually transmitted diseases and related syndromes in the District by interrupting the transmission of disease.The individual selected for this position will serve as the eHARS Data Manager within the Strategic Information Division(SID)
This position is grant funded. Continued employment under this appointment is contingent upon avaiability of funding.
Duties and Responsibilities
The incumbent provides primary data management support for software applications utilized by SID for surveillance activity including, but not limited to, the Enhanced HIV/AIDS Reporting System (eHARS) and the District of Columbia Public Health Information System (DC-PHIS). The incumbent is responsible for monitoring and evaluating timeless, completeness and quality of data collected through surveillance activities. Collaboration with other SID staff and external partners in efforts to ensure compliance with data reporting and collection standards are key responsibilities in this role.
The incumbent will be tasked to develop and implement routine processes for matching and integration of data elements from discrete data sources in the creation of comprehensive analytic datasets for assessing individual and population level service utilization and health outcome characteristics. This involves developing analytic datasets that includes data extracting, data scrubbing and variable coding. The incumbent also maintains accurate documentation concerning relevant surveillance program datasets including, but not limited to, variable lists and definitions, variable coding schemes, and inventories of data quality issues. Aids appropriate staff in the in the specification of routine and ancillary data collection, monitoring, and reporting business processes to facilitate the automation and integration of activities within the District of Columbia Public Health Information System (DC PHIS).
Qualifications and Education
One (1) year of experience that must be equivalent to at least the CS-9 grade level. Specialized experience is experience which is directly related to the position which has equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills, and abilities to successfully perform the duties of the position, and that is typically in or related to the work of this position.
Licenses and Certifications
None Required
Working Conditions/Environment
Work is performed in an office setting, with periodic offsite meetings involving external partners and/or community stakeholders. Occasional out-of-state travel may be required for work-related meetings, conferences, and/or training.
Other Significant Facts
Tour of Duty: Monday- Friday 08:15am -4:45pm
Promotion Potential: Promotion Potential to the CS-12
Collective Bargaining Unit: This position is covered by a Collective Bargaining Agreement Local AFGE 2978
Duration of Appointment: This is a Career Service- Term Appointment- Not to exceed 13 months.
Pay Plan, Series, and Grade: CS-301-11
Position Designation: This position has been designated as security sensitive. Pursuant to section 410 of Chapter 4 of the D.C. Personnel Regulations; in addition to the general suitability screening, the individuals applying for or occupying security sensitive positions are subject to the following checks and tests
Criminal background check
Traffic record check ( as applicable)
Consumer credit check (as applicable)
Reasonable suspicion drug and alcohol test; and
Post-accident or incident drug and alcohol tests.

title: Data Analyst Supporting the FBI Healthcare Fraud Section
description:
Focused on delivering unsurpassed services in support of law enforcement and homeland security, FSA, a rapidly growing joint venture owned by trusted solutions providers SAIC and AECOM, has a vacancy for a Data Analyst supporting Health Care Fraud Unit of the FBI.

Join the Health Care Fraud Unit and be part of a dynamic team that not only supports the FBI headquarters, but also provides opportunities for the team to participate in "Temporary Duty Assignments (TDY) supporting the FBI Field Offices. This unique opportunity allows employees to interact with colleagues in various locations, while also providing an opportunity to develop new skills as you grow your career with one of the most prestigious organizations in the law enforcement community.

The day to day environment consists of meaningful work at a steady pace while ensuring quality work products are produced without the added pressures of hard deadlines. Employees are encouraged to participate in teambuilding/bonding activities to include office celebrations, birthdays, anniversaries, milestones, awards and yes, even an occasional happy hour.

Additional office related benefits include:
Flexible work schedules; Overtime; Short-term TDY Travel; and Variety of special projects A Data Analyst executes the following duties:
Provide organization and management of case files Review data (completeness of information, proper execution) Extract data from data base Obtain additional information from other investigative agencies/data base Establish/maintain physical file Prepare notices/advertisements Receive, suspense petitions, claims, process sharing requests Reconcile inconsistencies Prepare declarations Gather information and organize investigative package Verify case files and case tracking system Maintain internal status information on the disposition of all forfeited assets Assure information is accurate and perform analytical computations necessary to process data Conduct and reconcile inventories Distribute and receive documents Assist lead analyst or official in obtaining/collecting all documents/information to complete case file Provide administrative information and assistance concerning case to other investigative agencies, local law enforcement agencies, US Attorney, and other DOJ processing units, and higher headquarters Extract data from agency data base for management and program reports Perform word processing relevant to case documentation Perform data entry relevant to case Candidates already possessing an Active Top Secret clearance are strongly preferred and are given first consideration.

A Data Analyst must meet the following qualifications:
High School diploma, bachelor's Degree preferred Ability to review and analyze data and information from multiple sources Ability to establish case/project files Ability to enter and retrieve data from data bases Ability to prepare and format management reports Ability to manipulate, transfer, and compute and print information Ability to create and manipulate spreadsheets Ability to prepare and correct reports and correspondence using word processing software Candidates already possessing an Active TS clearance are strongly preferred. Preference will be given to qualified applicants who are familiar with the specific policies, processes, procedures, and practices of this customer, and who are cleared to commence work immediately. Ability to obtain and maintain an Top Secret Security Access This position requires U.S. Citizenship and a 7 (or 10) year minimum background investigation.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Focused on delivering unsurpassed services in support of law enforcement and homeland security, FSA, a rapidly growing joint venture owned by trusted solutions providers SAIC and AECOM, has a potential vacancy for a Data Analyst. In this role, you will be supporting the overall mission of the Financial Litigation Unit of the USAO.

Review incoming material and independently perform on-line creation of routine and increasingly more complex debt records by entering data into the debt collection database. Routine cases include special assessment only, fines, restitution, and joint and several debts. Perform on-line data searches to retrieve documentation and analyze data from multiple sources. Compile case-related information to ensure a complete debt record in the debt collection database. Submit the completed case information to the appropriate district's FLU. Conduct quality control review of team members' work to ensure accuracy of data in the debt collection database. Research and post payments to ensure timely posting to debts in the debt collection database. Review reports to identify expired debts to be closed in the debt collection database in accordance with established procedures. Enter event codes associated with enforcement actions into the debt collection database to reflect accurate statistical accomplishments. Electronically initiate generation of form documents that do not require legal interpretation but require consideration of the nature and status of the case. Create and manipulate spreadsheets to track assignments or review and analyze management reports. Communicate in a professional and courteous manner with the Office of Legal Programs management, Government officials, and/or delinquent judgment debtors. Perform other related duties as assigned. A Data Analyst must meet the minimum qualifications:
Possess a high school diploma, four-year undergraduate degree is preferred, with a minimum of one (1) year of professional work experience, including data entry responsibilities. Work independently and efficiently, with guidance from supervisor and team members. Retrieve and analyze data and information from multiple sources. Attention to detail and quality control techniques to ensure accuracy. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office software programs (i.e., Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook) and in accessing, learning and maintaining various databases and on-line resource search engines. Operate a variety of office equipment, including personal computers, photocopiers, telephone systems, and scanners. Perform editing, reformatting, and generating written and electronic documents using MS Word and other document generation software. This position requires U.S. Citizenship and a 7 (or 10) year minimum background investigation.

title: Research Data Analyst
description:
Working at ICF Working at ICF means applying a passion for meaningful work with intellectual rigor to help solve the leading issues of our day. Smart, compassionate, innovative, committed, ICF employees tackle unprecedented challenges to benefit people, businesses, and governments around the globe. We believe in collaboration, mutual respect, open communication, and opportunity for growth. If you’re seeking to make a difference in the world, visit www.icf.com/careers to find your next career. ICF—together for tomorrow. Research Data Analyst Workforce Innovations and Poverty Solutions (WIPS) Team Fairfax, Virginia Job Description The Health, Environment, Analytics, Resilience, and Social policy (HEARS) group works to improve the conditions of America's most at-risk populations-reaching out directly to the populations in need, as well as providing strategic consulting support to human services agencies throughout the United States. Are you enthusiastic about solving social issues and making a difference in people's lives? This is the place for you! The Team is seeking a Research Analyst with to provide support across the Workforce Innovations and Poverty Solutions (WIPS) Team’s array of Federal, State, and Commercial technical assistance, research, and evaluation projects addressing critical social issue areas of employment and workforce programs, poverty solutions, fatherhood and family support initiatives, and interventions for families in at-risk situations. Are you a recent undergraduate with interest and ability to support our Team across these content and skill areas? We want you to apply! Key Responsibilities: Support training and technical assistance activities across the Team’s diverse array of projects. Perform background research on specified topics and synthesize material into fact sheets, blogs, literature reviews, and other products Support development and implementation of a wide and diverse range of quantitative and qualitative data collection tools virtually or on-site. Support the development and production of analyses and program trends/outcomes reports and targeted stakeholder publications/products Use administrative and programmatic data sets to evaluate program performance and support deeper problem exploration in a social services and workforce development setting. Coordinate logistics (e.g. teleconferences, virtual meetings, surveys, site visits, and Summits) . Preferred Qualifications: Fall/Winter 2018 or 2019 bachelor’s degree graduate in public policy, economics, business, sociology, or a relevant social field At least 1 + years of experience in social services, workforce development, poverty solutions, education, and work with families and vulnerable populations. Basic proficiency and experience in qualitative and/or quantitative data collection and analysis Ability to translate data analyses or highly technical information around career and technical education and apprenticeships to market to school districts and other non-technical audiences Basic experience in developing/creating dashboards and data visualization using Tableau or similar tools Proficient in MS applications, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Willingness to travel approximately 20% nationwide on an annual basis Professional Skills: Ability to work both independently and on a core team of staff members. Ability to balance and prioritize multiple projects to meet goals, deliverables, and deadlines Demonstrated experience working under pressure, both individually and collaboratively in a team environment Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities Interpersonal skills including courtesy, professionalism, and a cooperative attitude ICF offers an excellent benefits package, an award-winning talent development program, and fosters a highly skilled, energized and empowered workforce. ICF is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. (EOE – Minorities/Females/ Protected Veterans Status/Disability Status/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity). Reasonable Accommodations are available for disabled veterans and applicants with disabilities in all phases of the application and employment process. To request an accommodation please email icfcareercenter@icf.com and we will be happy to assist. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations. Read more about non-discrimination: EEO is the law and Pay Transparency Statement. About ICF: ICF (NASDAQ:ICFI) is a global consulting services company with over 7,000 full- and part-time employees, but we are not your typical consultants. At ICF, business analysts and policy specialists work together with digital strategists, data scientists and creatives. We combine unmatched industry expertise with cutting-edge engagement capabilities to help organizations solve their most complex challenges. Since 1969, public and private sector clients have worked with ICF to navigate change and shape the future. Learn more at icf.com.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Data Analyst

George Mason University, School of Business, invites applications for the position of Data Analyst. The Data Analyst supports the School of Business’s core activity in capturing and analyzing data on a variety of School of Business data points and metrics including faculty, students and staff. The Data Analyst will aid in data management related to assessment data for curriculum, co-curriculum, student services, and student engagement and satisfaction. The Data Analyst will work closely with the Director in building capacity for analytics, assessment, and research initiatives within the School. This is a full-time classified staff position. This position does not support work visa sponsorship.

George Mason University has a strong institutional commitment to the achievement of excellence and diversity among its faculty and staff, and strongly encourages candidates to apply who will enrich Mason’s academic and culturally inclusive environment.

Responsibilities:
The Data Analyst position has responsibilities in the following areas:

Research and Analysis: Conduct appropriate statistical and qualitative analysis methods to address research, assessment, and evaluation questions and goals; Develop and conduct in-depth analysis of institutional key performance indicators and associated measures for students, faculty and staff; In conjunction with the director, perform analysis of course schedule, faculty utilization, and key performance metrics; Assist the director in compiling, computing, and submit rankings information to the appropriate publication. Assessment: Generate research and evaluation reports that are clear, concise, and help act towards continuous improvement and other goals; Assist in the analysis of School key performance indicators. Aid in the oversight assessment data including assurance of learning, curriculum assessment, student engagement and satisfaction, as well as co-curricular programs and student services. Oversight of the Assurance of Learning (AoL) process, including working with faculty committees, departments, programs, and other faculty groups in coordination and implementation of the AoL plan; Ensure that data report is complete and accurate in university systems such as TK20 on an annual basis. Analytics and Visualization: Develop data visualization resources and strategy to increase access to and strategic use of data within the School of Business; Aid in the utilization of Qualtrics including the ability to develop and disseminate survey research; Help the Director adopt and implement analytics practices in the School of Business including the ability to understand current tools that are offered at the university with analytics capabilities, apply those tools to Business School students, and working with the appropriate constituents to design interventions aimed at improving key student success metrics such as learning, academic achievement, student satisfaction and engagement, student retention and graduation rates. Accreditation Related Activities: Conduct analysis on faculty impact including faculty contributions; Working with the Director, aid projects that have accreditation implications including AACSB, SACS and other accreditation that the school may pursue in the future; Perform market and benchmarking analysis on current trends in the accreditation space. Special Projects: Execute special projects as outlined and assigned by the Director of Analytics, Assessment, and Accreditation. Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in business, statistics, analytics or other related field, or combination of equivalent education and experience; Skills in data analysis, quantitative and qualitative analysis, and critical thinking; and Strong oral and written communication skills. Preferred Qualifications: Knowledge of higher education environment. Special Instructions to Applicants For full consideration, applicants must apply for position number 02800z at http://jobs.gmu.edu/ by August 14, 2019; complete and submit the online application; and upload a cover letter, resume, and a list of three professional references with contact information. The department will contact candidates directly should additional materials be required. Review of applications will begin August 15, 2019 and continue until the position is filled. For Full Consideration, Apply by: 08/14/2019

title: Data Analyst

title: Data Analyst
description:
The Research, Analysis, and Reporting team partner with divisions within OSSE across the PK-20 spectrum as well as our LEAs and other agencies across the District to promote the quality and transparency of education data and to inform policy and practice. The data analyst will support efforts to complete research and data requests, standardize data across all public and public charters schools and community based organizations in the District of Columbia, provide analytic support for program offices across the PK-20 spectrum, including the statewide accountability system, fulfill federal and local data reporting requirements, and contribute to analysis and reporting in alignment with the agency research agenda. The analyst will further promote the strategic use of data across the agency and serve as a champion for data-driven decision-making. Duties: Serves as a data analyst in the completion of education data deliverables including but not limited to research reports, public and federal reporting requirements and stakeholder requests. Uses subject matter expertise to support stakeholders in joint visioning of data analytic projects and deliverables and related methodologies and business rules. Creates data specifications, code and output in alignment with data analytic principles and best practices. Collaborates with team members within DAR and across the agency to produce timely, accurate and informative data analytics. Supports improvements in data quality including the standardization of data across public and public charter schools and community-based organizations. Serves as a data steward in the proper use and protection of student data. Specialized Experience: Knowledge of data analytic and quality assurance best practices. Knowledge of and/or strong interest in local and national education policies and programs Strong analytical skillset including programming experience in Stata and/or SQL. Strong attention to detail Ability to translate a data analytic problem into logical steps and procedures Ability to synthesize available data to present meaningful and pertinent facts and results Professional research skills to produce written and oral reports Ability to interpret and draft technical documentation and specifications Ability to execute multiple projects and/or deliverables simultaneously and on time ---------------------------------------------

company: Government of the District of Columbia
title: Crime Analyst
description:
There is only one city in the country that can say it is the Nation’s Capital – Washington, D.C. Given that distinction, the Metropolitan Police Department is the premiere law enforcement organization in the city. We receive over 22 million visitors a year, have almost 700,000 residents, and 21,000 private business. The Department consists of more than 4,500 members: approximately 3,850 sworn members and over 650 civilian employees. We are one of the most diverse and highly trained departments in the country. We have the honor of safeguarding and protecting not only our nation’s residents, but also people from all over the world. This position is assigned to the Homeland Security Bureau, Office of Research & Analytical Services Branch, located at 300 Indiana, Avenue, N.W., Washington, DC 20001. The incumbent manages query and summarizes raw data from the Metropolitan Police Department (MPD) data sources such as IMS, RMS, iLeads, WALES, WACISS, Computer Aided Dispatch and Criminal Justice Information System, and from other internal and external data sources. The Crime Analyst position is in the collective bargaining unit represented by the National Association for Government Employees (NAGE) R3-5 and you may be required to pay an agency fee through direct payroll deductions. The incumbent will be responsible for the following: Develops statistical summary reports, graphs, charts, and maps covering crime trends and patterns within specified time frames and geographic boundaries (e.g. neighborhood, District, PSA, Ward, and Citywide), some of which are updated on a periodic basis (e.g. daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, seasonally, and annually) for officials within the Department. Applies mapping techniques to provide research and analysis at any level of geography and depicts observations including change in crime rates and characteristics over time. Constructs presentations and dashboards that include computer-aided visualizations from software products such as ESRI ArcGIS Map, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, Tableau, etc. Conducts statistical modeling of police data to develop insights on crime trends, crime projections, and supporting information necessary for effective presentation. Provides analysis that assists in the deployment of manpower and the initiation and evaluation of tactical responses to high crime areas. Provides analysis that assists in preparing necessary materials and delivers presentations of current crime trends and patterns for command staff meetings. Provides analysis that assists in preparation for community meetings and the promotion of community problem solving. Prepares detailed factual, analytical, and narrative reports which include times, dates, location and other detailed information related to criminal activities and other areas being researched. Reviews and analyzes suspect information and criminal history for internal Metropolitan Police Department support units, including but not limited to specialty and investigative units. Documents data sources, maintains and organizes detailed records and files of assigned tasks and materials produced. Participates in interagency communications such as meetings, briefings, task forces, and bulletins to share and develop cooperative data or actively support surrounding jurisdictions. Pursues developmental opportunities relevant to tactical analysis of geographic locations and crimes that occurred in specific areas. Participates in developmental cross-training. Performs other related duties as required. Qualifications Applicants must have at least one (1) year of specialized experience equivalent to at least the CS-08 grade level, or its non-District equivalent, gained from the public or private sector. Including at least (1) one year experience in the following areas: Experience or education in principles, theories and techniques of crime and intelligence analysis. Effectively presenting oral presentations, written reports and visual tools such as maps, charts and graphs. Experience evaluating, analyzing and summarizing electronic data through the use of database, statistical, and mapping tools. Applying and conducting statistical computations such as spatial and temporal event series, projections, and time series regression modeling. Establishing and maintaining effective working or professional relationships with colleagues, school officials, managers, City officials, representatives of other law enforcement agencies, co-workers, and the general public. Interpreting oral, written, mathematical, statistical or technical information and data dealing with variables to identify, analyze, and produce management reports. Proficient in utilizing Microsoft Excel is required. Proficient with using a complex analytical software is preferred. Licensure Certifications and Other Requirements Must possess and maintain a valid driver’s license Education High School Diploma or equivalent is required. A Bachelor’s Degree is preferred, including at least some quantitative coursework, or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience. Work Experience At least 1 year previous work involving analytical and data collection. Applicants must have at least one (1) year of specialized experience equivalent to at least the CS-08 grade level or its non-District equivalent gained from the public or private sector. Specialized experience is defined as experience that equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills and abilities to perform successfully the duties of the position directly related to the position. Work Environment Work is primarily performed in an office setting. Other Significant Factors This position operates within the confines of a 24/7 operation. The person selected for this position may be required to provide after-hours on-call support including weekends and holidays. Positions with the Metropolitan Police Department require a criminal background, traffic record and consumer check. EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY: The District of Columbia Government is an Equal Opportunity Employer: all qualified candidates
will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital

responsibilities, matriculation, political affiliation, genetic information, disability. Sexual
harassment is a form of sex discrimination, which is also prohibited. In addition, harassment
based on any of the above-protected categories is prohibited.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Overview What do you get when you bring together the brightest minds and place them into an exciting, fast-paced environment that fosters intellectual growth and rewards based on impact, not tenure?
You get one of the fastest growing consulting companies in the United States. While we may be a new name in consultancy, we were born from a storied one. Guidehouse was founded in 2018 as an evolution of PwC Public Sector with a mission to help our clients deliver on their mission; providing bold new strategies that catalyze transformative results across all ends of the enterprise. We embrace brilliance. We embrace independence. Join us.

Responsibilities Our Data and Analytics consultants help clients maximize the value of their data. This high performing team helps clients define their information strategy, architecture and governance, get the most value from business intelligence and analytics, and implement enterprise content and data management solutions to enable business insights, reduce cost and complexity, increase trust and integrity, and improve operational effectiveness.

Qualifications
Desired Major: Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Economics, or similar quantitative discipline. Years of Experiences: 0-1 year ideally with previous internship experience
Knowledge Preferred:Demonstrates significant experience working with analytical models or techniques and the ability to apply such methods to an applicable challenge within the public sector. This background should include: • Statistical analysis and techniques;• Advanced proficiency in at least one programming language, such as R, Python, or SAS;• Visualization techniques and tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or R Shiny;• Advanced analytics techniques such as predictive modelling, simulation, artificial intelligence, and machine learning;• Business and operations analysis using quantitative techniques; Skills Preferred:Demonstrates thorough skills and/or proven success in a role participating in projects including the following: • Analyzing large and complex data sets, including a thorough aptitude for conducting quantitative and qualitative analyses;• Selecting and applying the appropriate analytical techniques in order to increase organizational efficiency;• Contributing as a team member: understanding personal and team roles, contributing to a positive working environment by building solid relationships with team members;• Identifying and addressing key problems, building relationships with clients, demonstrating flexibility in prioritizing and completing tasks, communicating potential conflicts to a supervisor;• Communicating effectively to various audiences (including various levels of management and external clients) in a professional environment;
Must be US CitizenProfessionals in Guidehouse LLP may be subject to a government security investigation and may need to meet related eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

Additional Requirements This position requires successful completion of a background check and employment verification. The successful candidate must not be subject to employment restrictions from a former employer (such as a non-compete) that would prevent the candidate from performing the job responsibilities as described.

Disclaimer Guidehouse is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions will be made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, military status, veteran status, handicap, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or other characteristics protected by law.
If you have visited our website for information about employment opportunities, or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation, please contact Guidehouse Recruiting at 1-571-633-1711 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@guidehouse.com. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodation.
Guidehouse offers a comprehensive, total rewards package that includes competitive compensation and a flexible benefits package that reflects our commitment to creating a diverse and supportive workplace.
Benefits include: Medical, Rx, Dental & Vision Insurance Personal and Family Sick Time & Company Paid Holidays Parental Leave and Adoption Assistance 401(k) Retirement Plan Student Loan Paydown Basic Life & Supplemental Life Health Savings Account, Dental/Vision & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts Short-Term & Long-Term Disability Tuition Reimbursement, Personal Development & Learning Opportunities Skills Development & Certifications Employee Referral Program Corporate Sponsored Events & Community Outreach Emergency Back-Up Childcare Program

title: Acquisitions Data Analyst
description:
VPD Government Solutions is a rapidly growing, employee-centric consulting company that provides Program, Acquisition, and Facilities Management services to Federal Government clients. We are seeking an Acquisitions Data Analyst to support our client at the Department of Veteran’s Affairs, Office of Information & Technology, Office of Strategic Sourcing – Acquisition Management (OSS AM). *Position Description:
*
The Acquisitions Data Analyst will be the point-person to oversee the daily support to each designated team under OSS AM to include the analysis of business, functional and technical reports. This person is responsible for the Performance Work Statements (PWS), ICGEs, and weekly reports. This position will provide direction to the Junior Engineer/Data Analyst. Responsibilities include: Assist all OSS AM Procurement Coordinators and Project Managers in analyzing and finalizing all applicable acquisition documents for complex IT technical requirementsAssist with analysis, requirements definition, planning, and evaluation of alternative technical approaches and associated costs for the development or enhancement of applications. Conduct analysis, cost/cost-performance trade-off analysis, feasibility analysis, and regulatory compliance supportDeliver Performance Work Statements and Independent Government Cost Estimates as a result of Technical AnalysisRespond to requests from OSS AM Team Leadership for document retrieval and various ad hoc reports and taskers, providing electronic copies of documents as requiredProvide weekly analysis of current workload for each OSS AM Team. This includes evaluating outputs from numerous VA IT systems and generating an MS Excel worksheet for OSS AM Team Leadership showing any inconsistencies or problem areasManage and maintain the internal VA provided OSS AM Virtual Package Development SharePoint site to include developing the project pages for each acquisition throughout each PoP and all other necessary system administrator functions for the siteCollect, store, organize and maintain pre-award and post-award contract data, documentation and artifacts associated with all contract actions for each Team under OSS AM Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Contracting, Acquisitions, Finance, IT Engineering, or other relevant field, or equivalentMinimum of fifteen (15) years of Acquisitions experience, supporting federal government IT acquisition programs/projects a plusSubject matter expertise with Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR), policies and practicesFAC, DAWIA, or, CPCM/CFCM requiredPrevious experience working at the Department of Veteran’s Affairs, or another government agency is a plusProven track record of conducting data analysis and demonstrated experience with metrics reportingStrong financial and analytical skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsStrong expertise with SharePointAbility to obtain a ClearanceU.S. Citizenship Why work for VPD? Robust employee benefits package including health, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance401(k) with employer matchingProfit sharingFlexible Time OffTuition reimbursement programOpportunities for professional development Location Washington, DC Job Type: Full-time Experience: relevant: 10 years (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required)

company: The DALE Foundation and Dental Assisting National Board, Inc ( DANB)
title: Business Systems and Data Analyst
description:
Who You Are 
 We are looking for a motivated Business Systems and Data Analyst who is ready to jump in, contribute, and make a difference. The Business Systems and Data Analyst is a key contributor who learns and understands the current business processes and uses their ability and expertise to recommend well-reasoned ways of enhancing, re-architecting and improving business processes and technical solutions to support business requirements. Business Systems and Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing, reporting and developing recommendations on data related to complex and varied business metrics. This is an exciting opportunity to change and evolve the information architecture and reporting of both organizations. You are someone who takes pride in your work, seeks order, and wants the opportunity to work with your like-minded individuals. You are a leader, not a follower, with an innovative spirit who wants to collaborate with a team of brilliant minds in our quest to provide the best products and services. The Business Systems and Data Analyst plays a key role in contributing to the organizations’ aspirations of operational excellence, exceptional customer service and high degree of stakeholder satisfaction, and faithfully meeting its contractual obligations owed to its stakeholders.  
 The ideal candidate must have:  
 Bachelor’s degree required; BSc/BA in computer science, information sciences or related field preferredMinimum of 2 years of experience analyzing, developing, and documenting custom reports dealing with information systemsProficiency with Oracle SQL Scripting, Java Script, Oracle APEX framework,Experience with Tableau and BOXI preferredExperience with Data Modeling and Analytics, Data Administration,Experience with CRM/LMS, CMS required 
 Who We Are  
 We are two affiliated national nonprofit organizations with shared office space and staff (that is, many staff working for both organizations, but with just one supervisor), located in Chicago’s River North neighborhood. We provide professional development opportunities for dental assistants and other dental auxiliaries, such as testing, professional certification and online education; we also conduct research to promote the profession and public health. We are a mid-sized, collaborative, friendly office that is driven by our related public protection missions. We offer work/life balance with a 37.5-hour work week, plus benefits including health insurance, a paired HRA and FSA, professional development assistance, generous vacation/PTO, 401(k) matching and more. 
 Competencies:  
 Analytical SkillsAttention to DetailCollaborationWritten Communication SkillsInitiativeIntegrity/Business EthicsOrganization SkillsProblem SolvingTechnical Knowledge and Translation 
 Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  
 Organizational Reporting & Analysis (30%)· Develop ad hoc queries and advanced reports using appropriate tools 
 Develop and maintain SQL queries and stored procedures 
 · Create reporting dashboards for management purposes· Create reporting specifications and define reporting requirements, in collaboration with staff 
 Develop SOPs for reports that include run-time instructions and description of report outputAssist in collecting, processing, reporting and analysis of post-exam and survey research dataAnalyze and propose new approaches to viewing and accessing dataKeep abreast of new reporting and analytics toolsManage 3rd party vendors or contractors who provide reporting development servicesCatalog, document, maintain and serve as the primary source of all reports developed for DANB and the DALE Foundation. 
 Data Management (30%)  
 Build and maintain data models for key business systems that are core to reporting and system design, integration and maintenance. Build additional data models as required.Demonstrate thorough understanding of the DANB and DALE Foundation data model and schema within the organization’s core applications such as the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system and Learning Management System (LMS)Ensure and enhance data integrity by identifying, designing and implementing system data input controls, user data input guidelines and procedures and reports that identify potential data anomalies and the procedures necessary to repair themAnalyze and convert data into information and insights that supports the business need to make reliable and insightful data-driven decisions 
 Application Support (20%) 
 Provide the highest level of internal knowledge and technical support capabilities of the CRM software modules and system capabilitiesSupport creation application operating processes and procedures with functional business groupsDevelop and configure application interfaces within the CRM system, using Oracle APEX frameworkTroubleshoot issues/problems to identify root causes of bugs and deficiencies with the CRM systemIn coordination with the Business Analyst, assess application-related support tickets to identify trends, common issues and opportunities to mitigate further issues by recommending application functional changes, staff training, creation of SOPs and other appropriate tactics.Manage and document the integrations between the CRM system and 3rd party platforms (exam administration vendor, content management system, accounting software, payment processor, learning management system, address verification) 
 Quality Assurance/Testing (10%) 
 In consultation with the Business Analyst, create test scripts used to ensure IT deliverables from both the IT department and external vendors are thoroughly tested and validated prior to internal stakeholder testing and acceptanceEnsure software application and functional updates do not introduce new issues or defects 
 Planning/Documentation/Training (5%) 
 Assist staff with application functionality training and testingManage and coordinate the implementation of IT system updates and new releases to ensure they are timed appropriately; staff training is accounted for and SOPs are adjusted as necessaryAssist CIO with staff technology initiatives (e.g., make recommendations to coordinate agenda development with each staff lead of these committees: Staff Technology Committee, Staff Business Improvement/Innovations Committee, Document Management Committee) 
 Miscellaneous (5%) 
 Perform IT support and other IT-related tasks as requiredStay abreast of emerging technologies and trendsParticipate in various staff meetingsParticipate in training as neededPerform other duties as assigned 
 Job Type: Full-time 
 Salary: $62,000.00 to $85,000.00 /year 
 Experience: 
 Relevant: 2 years (Required) 
 Benefits: 
 Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time offProfessional development assistanceTuition reimbursement 
 This Company Describes Its Culture as: 
 Team-oriented -- cooperative and collaborativePeople-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focusedOutcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culture

title: Healthcare Data Analyst
description:
CVS/Caremark, the Pharmacy Benefit Management (PBM) division of CVS Health, is looking for a Healthcare Data Analyst to join our Eligibility Administration Department. As a Healthcare Data Analyst for a Fortune 10 organization, you will impact and support customers/clients in all areas including Commercial, Medicare, Healthcare Plans & Group Waiver Plans (EGWP).

Primary responsibilities of the Healthcare Data Analyst include:
Acting as a healthcare data subject matter expert on Eligibility guidelines and Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) protocol for clients Researching and consulting to improve healthcare data integrity and ensure excellent service delivery Constantly improving healthcare analytical skills that are needed to perform data analysis Resolving data enrollment issues on a daily basis Consulting on healthcare data needs Having exceptional time management and healthcare client management skills Continuous development training will be provided in this role to ensure the Healthcare Data Analyst is able to exceed client expectations in this fast-paced environment
Required Qualifications
1+ years in healthcare data eligibility, insurance, IT, benefits or data analytics environment with a strong ability to work independently, problem solve, and analyze data in a confidential healthcare environment.
Preferred Qualifications
3+ years in eligibility or other relevant background2+ years customer service or client-facing experience in a fast-paced environmentExperience in EDI (Electronic Data Interchange)Understanding of the PBM industryKnowledge of ANSI X12 834 Data DocumentsFamiliarity with RxClaim and/or AS400
Education
High School Diploma or GED requiredBachelor's Degree preferred
Business Overview
It’s a new day in health care.

Combining CVS Health and Aetna was a transformative moment for our company and our industry, establishing CVS Health as the nation’s premier health innovation company. Through our health services, insurance plans and community pharmacists, we’re pioneering a bold new approach to total health. As a CVS Health colleague, you’ll be at the center of it all.

We offer a diverse work experience that empowers colleagues for career success. In addition to skill and experience, we also seek to attract and retain colleagues whose beliefs and behaviors are in alignment with our core values of collaboration, innovation, caring, integrity and accountability.

CVS Health is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Gender/Ethnicity/Disability/Protected Veteran – we highly value and are committed to all forms of diversity in the workplace. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities. We comply with the laws and regulations set forth in the following EEO is the Law Poster: EEO IS THE LAW and EEO IS THE LAW SUPPLEMENT. We provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you require assistance to apply for this job, please contact our Advice and Counsel Reasonable Accommodations team. Please note that we only accept applications for employment via this site.

If technical issues are preventing you from applying to a position, contact Kenexa Helpdesk at 1-855-338-5609 or cvshealthsupport@us.ibm.com. For technical issues with the Virtual Job Tryout assessment, contact the Shaker Help Desk at 1-877-987-5352.

title: Fraud Analyst
description:
TransNational is seeking a new Fraud Investigator to join its growing Risk department. The Fraud Investigator is an advocate for the protection of the firm, as well as, it’s merchants. As part of a collaborative team, the Fraud Investigator will be monitoring day to day merchant processing and trends to identify potential fraudulent transactions. The Fraud Investigator’s mission is to identify and analyze fraud patterns, expose deceptive practices, and prevent or mitigate loss. The Fraud Investigator will have a strong ability to fact find and de-escalate client facing situations 
 The Fraud Investigator will have the opportunity to join an award winning culture and truly make an impact by owning the audit process and making quick, impactful decisions as part of a team. The Fraud Investigator is a growth opportunity with advancement ability and professional development. 
 Your day-to-day:  
 Monitor and audit up to 500 accounts per day looking for business irregularities and potential fraudulent activity; the audit activities are extremely time sensitive so the ability to move quickly is paramountInvestigate suspicious activity through research and outreach to merchants; making proactive outbound calls to all of the parties involved to initiate the audit process and gain pertinent transaction information:Identify reason and purpose for the transaction through the merchant; collecting evidence to validateObtain documentation for verification between banks and the cardholderEngaging the cardholder for verificationOversee the charge back inquiry process by assisting merchants through chargeback transactions; representing the best interests of the merchant in the event of cardholder fraudTaking ownership, from start to finish, of a transaction in verifying its legitimacyMitigate past due amounts owed and collection efforts by surfacing accurate data 
 We’d love to hear from you if you have:  
 1 year of experience in claims investigation or auditing required; or if you are naturally an inquisitive, intuitive, and skeptical person – let’s chat!Bachelor’s degree preferred or Associate’s degree with relevant work experienceExcellent communication abilities with the supernatural power of de-escalating situations and fact finding at the same timeAbility to operate under tight deadlines and manage time and priorities independently and effectively; if you need micro management to accomplish tasks this is not for you! 
 Why TransNational is the answer for your career:  
 Comprehensive benefits package including zero-cost health care option401k MatchPaid Volunteer DayPaid Vacation and Sick timeRidiculously fun social eventsFree access to an on-site Fitness CenterMinutes from the Rosemont Blue-Line stop with free building shuttle service daily 
 TransNational is an equal opportunity employer and recruitment services provider and does not unlawfully discriminate against any applicant or candidate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation or any other class protected by federal or state law. 
 Job Type: Full-time 
 Experience: 
 Fraud Analyst: 1 year (Preferred) 
 Benefits: 
 Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time offParental leaveProfessional development assistance

title: Data Analyst (HEDIS)
description:
Founded on the principles of trust, experience, and innovation, Trexin Consulting specializes in strategy execution – the effective implementation of business strategy to achieve a specific business goal. Also referred to as applied strategy, strategy execution situations that Trexin frequently leads include: scaling capabilities for growth, optimizing operations for cost reduction, driving synergies for M&A and recovering projects in distress. Trexin’s services are right-sized for our Clients’ needs, ranging from our “Diamond Team” service when our Clients want Trexin to own an outcome and share delivery risk, to Expert / Advisory services for senior-level guidance, to Strategic Staffing services for execution-oriented tasks and roles. Our expertise spans Healthcare, Life Sciences, Financial Services, and Products & Distribution, overlaid by multidisciplinary skills in the five capabilities essential to executing strategy: Aligned Enterprise, Program Execution, Technology, Innovation and Analytics. 
 Job Title 
 Data Analyst (HEDIS) 
 Trexin Consulting is currently seeking a Data Analyst (with HEDIS experience) to join our team in Chicago and consult at our Healthcare clients. 
 Key Areas of Responsibility:  
 Work on multiple project tasks in support of the technical requirements and analysis to develop and validate a solution design in the data, information and ETL domains in support of an end-to-end analysis development, management, and delivery.Intensive data analysis from a documentation, investigation and technical profiling (queries) perspective.Interface between various business and technical teams to compile requirements.Provide technical leadership to the team.Continuously gain a deeper understanding of relevant data and processes to build analytic solutions to meet business needs.Gather and assess business information needs and preparing system and data requirements.Perform analyses and profiling of the data, create detailed mapping documentation including transformation rules. 
 Key Desired Skills, Experience and Knowledge:  
 Understanding of healthcare / payor data, subject areas, and source systems.Understand data, data relationships at the table and attribute level.Able to interpret measurement definitions, and perform data decomposition.Perform Gap analysis and impact analysis on any changes that are being suggested.Possess working knowledge of Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS) and data warehouse, including full reference architecture from data integration, through semantic layer and reporting.Strong knowledge of data and dimensional modeling.Experienced in group facilitation with participants from diverse business functions and work skills.Six (6) plus years of professional experience working in IT.Strong understanding of different data sources and healthcare data domains (Claims, Membership, Provider, Clinical etc.).Data Mining, critical thinking and deep data analysis experience.Ability to reverse engineer SQL Code and existing DataStage ETL processes.Experience with Teradata or Oracle warehousing.Ability to find data in DB2 and Teradata.HDFS experience and the ability to navigate and read data. 
 _Trexin is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. Trexin is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Trexin are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications. We do not discriminate against race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. 
 Trexin Consulting does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third party recruiting agencies in response to job postings. No fee will be paid to third parties who submit unsolicited candidates directly to our hiring managers or Recruiting Team. All candidates must be submitted via our Applicant Tracking System by approved Trexin Consulting vendors who have been expressly requested to make a submission by our Recruiting Team for a specific job opening. No placement fees will be paid to any firm unless such a request has been made by the Trexin Consulting Recruiting Team and such candidate was submitted to the Trexin Consulting Recruiting Team via our Applicant Tracking System._ 
 Job Type: Contract 
 Work authorization: 
 United States (Required)

title: Software Quality Assurance Analyst
description:
Software Quality Assurance Analyst 
 Job Description:  
 We are currently seeking a driven, detail-oriented Software Quality Assurance Analyst (QA) with strong analytical skills to join our development team. 
 Our QAs support the development team by completing testing of internally developed applications and documenting testing results, and other quality assurance activities as required. Our development team contributes to a diverse range of projects that include data extraction, transformation and loading (ETL) solution development, reporting and analytics, web application development, email design, WPF application development, and other solution development as required.

 Responsibilities:  
 Work closely alongside our development team to deliver high quality code supporting client deliverables and internal business processes.Complete manual and/or automated testing of internally developed solutionsCreate and maintain documentation of testing resultsContribute to documentation of program functionality as requiredLeverage your expertise to contribute to solution architectureWork alongside the development team to optimize existing processes 
 Qualifications:  
 Associate degree from an accredited institution. A degree in computer science or related field is preferred.1 to 3 years professional experience working as a developer or QA is preferredKnowledge of/experience with the Microsoft stackKnowledge of/experience working in the context of one or more common project management methodologies (Scrum, Agile, Waterfall, etc.)Knowledge of/experience with general systems architecture concepts (client-server, web-based, etc.)Knowledge of/experience with Change Management protocols and the SDLCOrganized and detail-oriented (extremely important)Strong written and oral communication skillsComfortable working in a fast-paced, growth-focused environment
